messages.content: Text created/updated with CEFR level A2

Text saved: Before, I worked a normal five-day week. I had time off work for my baby. After that, I wanted more time with my children before they start school. I talked with my boss and we agreed to change my work week. Now I work three days a week. This also meant I get much less money because I only get paid for the days I work. But now I see my amount of work is the same. It is not less at all. I do five days of work in only three days, but I get much less money for it.
Feedback received: Grade 4/10 - FAIL

metadata.feedback_text:
FAIL: Meaning Preservation Failure. The MeaningBERT score of 0.7227 is below the required 0.75 threshold. This indicates a failure to preserve the core message of the original text.

- The original text conveys a strong sense of complaint and unfairness, particularly with the phrase "my workload hasn't decreased in the slightest!".
- Your version, "my amount of work is the same. It is not less at all," is too neutral and factual. It states a condition but fails to capture the negative emotional tone which is central to the original's meaning.
- The simplification has removed the feeling of being unfairly treated, which is a critical component of the source text.

Suggestion: Restore the sense of a negative outcome. Rephrase to show this is a problem. For example: "But the problem is my work is still the same." or "But I still have to do the same amount of work, and this is not fair."
